text:
I would never post on my Linkedin before going to these sites first:

1. ChatGPT, chat.com

A no-brainer.

✦ Deep Research topics.
✦ Find trends, brainstorm angles.
✦ Turn my learnings into repeatable GPTs. 

Anything I learn about growing on Linkedin, I teach it to ChatGPT. And then I turn it into my own GPT.

2. Gamma, gamma.app

From text to clean visuals fast.

✦ Turn drafts into carousels or decks.  
✦ Auto-layout, styles, and web export.  
✦ Great for briefs and simple sites.

I paste my outline and hit generate. Then I tweak copy and flow instead of wrestling with slides.

3. EasyGen, easygen.io

My LinkedIn co-writer.

✦ Turn raw notes into post drafts.  
✦ Suggest hooks, CTAs, and variants.  
✦ Predict topics likely to trend for me.

I feed it ideas from DMs or comments. It returns five angles. Also obsessed with the "Trending" tab to know what went viral for me & other creators I stalk.

4. Notion, notion.so

Where my content lives.

✦ Calendar for drafts, posts, and repurposing.  
✦ Templates for ideas, hooks, and carousels.  
✦ Capture → edit → schedule in one place.

I see gaps at a glance and avoid last-minute scrambling. I also post 3x a day, so it's necessary.

5. Perplexity, perplexity.ai

Research with receipts.

✦ Find breakout questions and topics.  
✦ Cross-check sources to avoid blind spots.
✦ Summarize papers, reports, even YouTube.  

Perfect for backing claims with links. I pull stats, verify, and move on. Search better than ChatGPT.

6. Grok, grok.com

Real-time trend radar.

✦ See what top accounts push now.  
✦ Grab quotes to reference in posts.
✦ Search tweets, threads, and memes fast.  

Everything breaks on X before LinkedIn. Both platforms are so different, it's key to be on both.

7. Canva, canva.com

Fast polish.

✦ Carousels, infographics, thumbnails.  
✦ Background remover and Magic Erase.  
✦ Brand Kit to stay on-style.

I keep a few templates and swap text. Looks pro without a designer. Best value for money.

8. Opus Clip, opus.pro

Long video → shorts videos.

✦ Auto-cuts, captions, and punch-ins.  
✦ Finds highlight moments by topic.  
✦ Exports in every social size.

I upload a talk or webinar. It finds the hooks and hands me publish-ready clips. Same with YouTube.

I wrote an entire blog on "How much money you should spend on AI", highlighting three budgets.

↳ $20/mo budget (that's the minimum)
↳ $200/mo budget (that's my budget)
↳ $2,000/mo budget (for the lunatics)
